newsitem.title: USA: Cyberspace suspect released on bail.
newsitem.headline: Cyberspace suspect released on bail.

text.p: A doctoral candidate at Columbia University, charged with sexually torturing a woman he met over the Internet, has been freed from jail after posting $350,000 bail, officials said Saturday.
Oliver Jovanovic, 30, was freed Thursday evening after having spent a week at the Rikers Island jail while his parents raised the bail money.
Jovanovic's next court appearance was scheduled for Thursday.

Prosecutors said Jovanovic was accused of sexually abusing a 20-year-old Barnard College student he met while conversing with her in a "chat room" on the Internet. The woman later met Jovanovic for a dinner date and then agreed to go to his apartment to watch videos.

Prosecutors said that once at the apartment Jovanovic allegedly abused the young woman in 20 hours of bondage during which her legs were tied to a chair. He also allegedly burned her with candle wax and threatened to dismember her before finally letting her go.
Jovanovic has "categorically" denied the charged through his lawyer.
The woman did not go to authorities until two weeks after the Nov. 22 incident and continued to communicate with him over the Internet, authorities said.
